page.title: 16Entertainment
page.content: The fountain is an attractive 14th century thatched coaching inn with a small pond at the front and maintaining original timbers and fireplace. It was a private hotel in the 1930s with its own airfield nearby. This popular pub owned by Corage Brewery with its resteraunt is patronised by local people, businessmen and visitors from expanding Milton Keynes. The Lowndes Arms, built in 1550 was renamed as a mark of respect for the Selby-Lowndes, who lived in Whaddon Hall, at the turn of the century. It is now owned by Aylesbury Brewery and features large fireplaces and these are used for hanging palma hams which are served on special occasions. There is a dart board and juke box. Local people enjoy the pub for its village atmosphere and excellent steak meals.
